channel.title: iClarity - Eclipse
channel.description:
I am making a new server from scratch using iClarity. I need someone to tell me how to set it up in eclipse so I can run it through eclipse and code through it.
Thanks.

item.title: iClarity - Eclipse
item.dc:creator: @Runescape-Xperia Runescape-Xperia
item.description:
@Runescape-Xperia wrote:

[quote=“Bryanc, post:2, topic:414442”]If you’re using iClarity you’re not making it from scratch…

Anyways,

Just make a new project in eclipse (File -> New -> Java Project or right click in the left pane (project explorer) and new -> java project)

Now right click on your project -> import. import a file system and goto the iClarity folder.

I am not sure how iClarity is setup, but if it doesn’t have a src folder this isn’t going to work very well. So in that case, just drag all the java files into the src folder in the project explorer. You will also need to make the folders like data/ or whatever else iClarity uses.[/quote]
There is a SRC and I didn’t mean making my own from complete blank notepad I meant this.https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,468525.msg3425213.html#msg3425213

ALso, I dont understand.

Read full topic

item.title: iClarity - Eclipse
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

If you’re using iClarity you’re not making it from scratch…

Anyways,

Just make a new project in eclipse (File -> New -> Java Project or right click in the left pane (project explorer) and new -> java project)

Now right click on your project -> import. import a file system and goto the iClarity folder.

I am not sure how iClarity is setup, but if it doesn’t have a src folder this isn’t going to work very well. So in that case, just drag all the java files into the src folder in the project explorer. You will also need to make the folders like data/ or whatever else iClarity uses.

Read full topic
